intro: Pepinia quesnelioides, commonly known as the Quezel's pepinia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy leaves and stems, adapted to its high-altitude environment. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
